statement.p: Tomi is conducting market research on the cost of a cruise vacation. Tomi has determined that the average cost of a cruise vacation is 4000, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 454.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends more than 4380 on a cruise vacation.
b. The cost of the middle 30 of cruise vacations falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 19 of cruise vacations cost at least how much? (round to the nearest dollar)
